IMF Online Learning

Learning Channel on YouTube

The IMF Institute launched its Learning Channel on YouTube! offering short and targeted on-demand microlearning videos. New playlists will be posted every two weeks. Subcribe now!

IMF Online Learning

The IMF online learning program is helping increase the accessibility of IMF expertise to broader audiences during the COVID-19 pandemic. All IMF online courses have been made available to government officials and members of the general public with extended registration and completion timelines.

Public Sector Debt Statistics (PSDSx)

This new course is for anyone interested in learning the fundamentals of compiling and disseminating public debt statistics that are comprehensive and internationally comparable. Watch the course video.

Compilation Basics for Macroeconomic Statistics (CBMSx)

This new course introduces you to the basic concepts, skills and principles required to compile and disseminate macroeconomic statistics. Watch the course video.

Foundations of Central Bank Law (FCBLx)

This new course discusses the legal foundations for effective, autonomous, well-managed and accountable central banks. Watch the course video.

RA-GAP Tax Gap Analysis (VGAPx)

This new course provides instruction on how to prepare the data for and execute the VAT gap estimation model (V-GEM) of the IMF’s Revenue Administration Gap Analysis Program (RA-GAP). Watch the course video.

Financial Development and Financial Inclusion (FDFIx)

This new course discusses frameworks and policies for financial market development and financial inclusion. Watch the course video.

Model-Based Monetary Policy Analysis and Forecasting (MPAFx)

This course uses detailed country data highlighting an inflation targeting central bank, for hands-on filtration and calibration exercises. Watch the course video.



Register Now

  • General public
Follow us on    

  Acknowledgment

We are grateful to Japan, the longest-standing partner for IMF capacity development. Their partnership makes delivery of IMF online learning possible, including the Learning Channel on YouTube. Many partners provide financial support to develop specific online learning courses. We are appreciative of all partnerships in support of this innovative platform to share knowledge globally.

Related Links

  • Capacity Development
  • IMF Training Catalog
  • IMF Institute Learning Channel
  • Japan-IMF Scholarship Program
Contact us

For more information on courses and training, please send your requests to ICDinfo@imf.org

IMF MOOCs

The IMF has partnered with edX, the nonprofit online learning initiative founded by Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, to offer online training. With this partnership, and with generous financial support from the Government of Japan, the Fund is able to expand the reach of its training program to member country officials and to offer access to its training courses to a wider public audience through massive open online courses (MOOCs).

Reach of Online Learning

During the COVID-19 pandemic, IMF online courses have been made available to government officials and members of the general public with extended registration and completion timelines. In addition, the IMF Institute launched its Learning Channel on YouTube, offering short and targeted on-demand microlearning videos. Subscribe now!

Successful IMF MOOC Participants
